parameters.name: AclAction
parameters.description:
The action that Cloud Firewall performs on the traffic. Valid values:

*   **accept**: allows the traffic.
*   **drop**: denies the traffic.
*   **log**: monitors the traffic.

parameters.name: ApplicationName
parameters.description:
The application type supported by the access control policy. Valid values:

*   **FTP**
*   **HTTP**
*   **HTTPS**
*   **Memcache**
*   **MongoDB**
*   **MQTT**
*   **MySQL**
*   **RDP**
*   **Redis**
*   **SMTP**
*   **SMTPS**
*   **SSH**
*   **SSL_No_Cert**
*   **SSL**
*   **VNC**
*   **ANY**

> The value of this parameter is based on the value of Proto. If Proto is set to TCP, you can set ApplicationName to any valid value. If Proto is set to UDP, ICMP, or ANY, you can set ApplicationName only to ANY. You must specify at least one of the ApplicationNameList and ApplicationName parameters.

parameters.name: ApplicationNameList
parameters.description: The application types supported by the access control policy.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: The description of the access control policy.

parameters.name: DestPort
parameters.description:
The destination port in the access control policy. Valid values:

*   If Proto is set to ICMP, DestPort is automatically left empty.

> If Proto is set to ICMP, access control does not take effect on the destination port.

*   If Proto is set to TCP, UDP, or ANY and DestPortType is set to group, DestPort is empty.

> If DestPortType is set to group, you do not need to specify the destination port number. All ports on which the access control policy takes effect are included in the destination port address book.

*   If Proto is set to TCP, UDP, or ANY and DestPortType is set to port, the value of DestPort is the destination port number.

parameters.name: DestPortGroup
parameters.description:
The name of the destination port address book in the access control policy.

> If DestPortType is set to group, you must specify the name of the destination port address book.

parameters.name: DestPortType
parameters.description:
The type of the destination port in the access control policy.

Valid values:

*   **port**: port
*   **group**: port address book

parameters.name: Destination
parameters.description:
The destination address in the access control policy.

Valid values:

*   If DestinationType is set to net, the value of this parameter is a CIDR block.

    Example: 1.2.XX.XX/24

*   If DestinationType is set to group, the value of this parameter is an address book name.

    Example: db_group

*   If DestinationType is set to domain, the value of this parameter is a domain name.

    Example: \*.aliyuncs.com

*   If DestinationType is set to location, the value of this parameter is a location.

    Example: \["BJ11", "ZB"]

parameters.name: DestinationType
parameters.description:
The type of the destination address in the access control policy. Valid values:

*   **net**: CIDR block
*   **group**: address book
*   **domain**: domain name
*   **location**: location

parameters.name: Direction
parameters.description:
The direction of the traffic to which the access control policy applies. Valid values:

*   **in**: inbound traffic
*   **out**: outbound traffic

parameters.name: IpVersion
parameters.description:
The IP version supported by the access control policy.

Valid values:

*   **4**: IPv4
*   **6**: IPv6

parameters.name: Lang
parameters.description:
The language of the content within the request and response. Valid values:

*   **zh**: Chinese (default)
*   **en**: English

parameters.name: NewOrder
parameters.description: The priority of the access control policy. The priority value starts from 1. A smaller priority value indicates a higher priority.

parameters.name: Proto
parameters.description:
The protocol type supported by the access control policy. Valid values:

*   **ANY**
*   **TCP**
*   **UDP**
*   **ICMP**

parameters.name: Release
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to enable the access control policy. By default, an access control policy is enabled after the policy is created. Valid values:

*   **true**: enables the access control policy.
*   **false**: disables the access control policy.

parameters.name: Source
parameters.description:
The source address in the access control policy. Valid values:

*   If SourceType is set to net, the value of this parameter is a CIDR block.

    Example: 1.1.XX.XX/24

*   If SourceType is set to group, the value of this parameter is an address book name.

    Example: db_group

*   If SourceType is set to location, the value of this parameter is a location.

    Example: \["BJ11", "ZB"]

parameters.name: SourceIp
parameters.description: The source IP address of the request.

parameters.name: SourceType
parameters.description:
The type of the source address in the access control policy. Valid values:

*   **net**: CIDR block
*   **group**: address book
*   **location**: location
